info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN ALLEGHENY COUNTY THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 744 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sewickley, or over Moon Township, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Moon Township, Franklin Park, Shaler Township, Plum, North Side Pittsburgh, Hampton Township, and Wilkinsburg. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 46 and 54. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 63 and 72. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 76 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
